history.content: I took it in Summer 2018. That year, the first midterm was really early, in the second week, although it looks like they usually do it in the third week. Looking at this year's website, https://cs61bl.org/su20/, it appears to be in the third week again, so it will probably cover all content up to the last lab before the midterm, i.e. Java basics, Git, OOP, Linked Lists, Runtime analysis, etc. I'd recommend looking at (and working through, when the time comes to study!) some exams from past years to get a better idea of what topics might be covered. See https://cs61bl.org/su19/, https://cs61bl.org/su18/, https://cs61bl.org/su17/, etc. Anyway, remember to relax and enjoy the next week before the class starts. I hope you like 61bl, it's very interesting and useful material, taught in a format that is fun and works well!

Looking at this years website, https://cs61bl.org/su20/, it appears to be in the third week again, so it will probably cover all content up to the last lab before the midterm, i.e. Java basics, Git, OOP, Linked Lists, Runtime analysis, etc. I'd recommend looking at (and working through, when the time comes to study!) some exams from past years to get a better idea of what topics might be covered. See https://cs61bl.org/su19/, https://cs61bl.org/su18/, https://cs61bl.org/su17/, etc. Anyway, remember to relax and enjoy the next week before the class starts. I hope you like 61bl, it's very interesting and useful material, taught in a format that is fun and works well!

To anyone who has taken CS 61BL within the last few years,

What topics usually go on a midterm 1 for a CS 61BL? Is it usually the first two weeks or is it all content up to the last lab before the midterm?

Thank You,

Ryota Inagaki
history.subject: CS 61BL Midterm 1
